item.title: Microclimate ecology
item.description: Microclimates are the climates experienced by organisms on Earth, whether they be a seedling in a forest understory or a bird flying through the tree tops. I use mechanistic microclimate models to estimate these proximal climate conditions and understand how they shape species’ distributions under current and future climate change.

item.title: 3D Ecology
item.description:
Examining 3-dimensional distributions of species and their traits.

3D climate velocity

Climate velocity describes the speed and direction that species are expected to shift locally in response to climate change. However, studies have not previously incorporated impacts of vegetation on microclimates across the land surface and vertically from the ground to the canopy. We examine how accounting for vegetation impacts local climate velocities in two and three dimensions. This work expands methods used to calculate local climate velocities to incorporate a third dimension from the ground to the canopy, allowing us to examine how arboreal species may respond to climate change using vertical climate gradients.

item.title: Pandas
item.description: Flexible and powerful data analysis / manipulation library for Python, providing labeled data structures.

item.title: PyTorch
item.description: PyTorch is a Python package that provides tensor computation (like NumPy) with strong GPU acceleration.

item.title: scikit-learn
item.description: scikit-learn is a Python module for machine learning built on top of SciPy and is distributed under the 3-Clause BSD license.
